Determining Eligibility When the Physical Location of a Dependent Is Unknown
Do not pay benefits for any dependent whose physical location is unknown since there is no way of establishing that the claimed dependent is alive.
Exception
:Â  If the Veteran is making child support payments through a court or state agency for a child whose physical location is unknown, additional benefits may be paid for the child, provided the dependent is otherwise established for Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) purposes.
